So yeah... Why the hell do I even bother to check the comment section of any new game anymore? Specially regarding franchises as big as DBZ. It's alright if you like this game, it's alright if you don't. It's alright this might be your favourite Dragonball game of all time, it's alright if it won't. My problem is...why the FUCK to compare, drag other titles or other franchises that have absolutely NOTHING to do with each other through the mud just because of a need to feel ''in the winning team''?. I'm personally anxious to see what this game will look like fully developed, but why to ditch MvCI (for example)? I really like where it is going as well, with the premise that it isn't fully developed either. Who knows? Maybe capcom could make a miracle before it's release. The game also has been compared to Xenoverse. Again, same franchise, but a completely different goal or target audience. For the looks of it, this game will either follow the story in limited battles through certain arcs or even might not have story at all, while Xenoverse focused on that and giving a different Dragonball experience with a new context and a gameplay accessible for FANS OF THE FRANCHISE, not FANS OF TECHNICISM BASED, METICULOUS FIGHTING GAMES based on how long your combos are (games I also like, but again...different goals).


Again: Why to compare and why to take advantage of something looking good to rub it on someone or something that has nothing to do with it? I just take the time to post this because I've seen it enough for it to tick me off and make me feel disgust at those who seem to like what I like, which is uncomfortable and a pity. Like, stuff going bad enough to make someone quit their likings because of the behavior of the mass is just a ridiculous thought, but at this rate, it's even inevitable to think about it.
